isis.stitle: TSI 95-13-01 - Spicer Production and Service Transmission Input Shaft 10 Tooth Spline Manufacturing Design Change

subjectgroup.subject: Spicer Production and Service Transmission Input Shaft 10 Tooth Spline Manufacturing Design Change

lev1.title: Objective
lev1.para: Call attention to change in appearance of subject 10 tooth spline created by elimination of grinding the spline O.D.

lev1.title: Transmission Models Affected
lev1.para: All Spicer Current Production Transmission Assemblies and all Future Transmission Input Shaft Service replacements.

lev1.title: Customer Concerns
lev1.para: Is the transmission input shaft 10 tooth spline O.D. machined correctly, because it is not smooth and shiny as it was in previous years?
What is the reason for the change in appearance of the transmission input shaft 10 tooth spline O.D. compared to Spicer transmission input shafts manufactured in the past?

lev1.title: Reasons For Change
lev1.para: All known clutch designs do not require that the transmission input shaft 10 tooth spline O.D. have a ground smooth finish.
Transmission input shaft 10 tooth spline O.D. grind operation is not necessary for the part or the clutch to function properly.
Grinding the transmission input shaft 10 tooth spline eliminated to facilitate manufacturing.

partsinfo.para: Subject manufacturing design change applies to all Spicer Transmission Input Shafts manufactured after approximately 5-1-95.
